page.title: 18BENENDEN WEALD, FIREPLACE.
page.content: Four Wents House centres round its large inglenook fireplace, which has recently been rescued from layers of red paint to show its fine brickwork, with two unusual pairs of steps behind the fire. On the left is a shallow cupboard and a small arched recess, possibly for salt and spices. The right corner has the old bread oven which partly remains linking through to the kitchen, its iron door and some tools still guarding it. Above the main beam are two small nooks occupied by vases partly hidden by the festoons of hops. The fire now sits on a modern brick floor but these bricks tone well with the old ones and the whole room is pervaded by the lovely scent of wood ash. A metal canopy enables the fire to heat the sitting room and much of the house very effectively.
